intro: Mezoneuron procumbens, commonly known as the creeping mezoneuron, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant features a low-growing, spreading habit with slender stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, producing tiny, pale yellow blooms. Mezoneuron procumbens is noted for its ability to thrive in humid conditions and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
